items.title: Indian tribunal reinstates US lenders in Byju’s case
items.summary:
- The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has reinstated US lenders Glas Trust Company and Aditya Birla Finance in the creditors’ committee of Byju’s insolvency proceedings.
- The decision removed Pankaj Srivastava, the bankruptcy administrator, who previously excluded Glas Trust due to its involvement in a US case.
- Byju’s, founded in 2015, has faced significant financial struggles and legal issues, with its valuation dropping from US$22 billion to zero since the COVID-19 pandemic.

items.title: Chips don’t lie: Did China’s latest AI just beat the US?
items.summary:
- The White House emphasized the need for AI to operate on American technology after reports of China's AI advancements.  
- China's DeepSeek launched an AI model in November 2024 and became the most downloaded app on Apple's App Store by January 27, 2025.  
- DeepSeek's model reportedly performs as well as OpenAI's ChatGPT-4 but at a significantly lower cost.  
- The launch has raised concerns in the US, affecting stock prices of major companies like Nvidia.

items.title: World’s largest sovereign wealth fund reports $222b profit
items.summary:
- Norway’s sovereign wealth fund reported a profit of 2.5 trillion kroner (US$222.4 billion) for 2024.
- This profit surpassed the previous record of 2.22 trillion kroner (US$196.6 billion) from 2023.
- The growth was primarily driven by strong stock market performance, particularly in technology.
- The fund’s total value reached 19.7 trillion kroner (US$1,744 trillion), reflecting a 13% investment return, 45 basis points lower than its benchmark index.
- NBIM CEO Nicolai Tangen highlighted that American technology stocks significantly contributed to the growth.

items.title: Sam Altman to visit India amid legal challenges: sources
items.summary:
- Sam Altman, CEO of OpenAI, plans to visit India next week, marking his first trip in two years.
- Expected arrival in New Delhi on February 5, with potential meetings with government officials.
- India is OpenAI's second-largest market by user numbers after the US.
- Last visit in 2023 included a meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss AI in India.
- OpenAI faces legal challenges in India, including a copyright lawsuit from ANI.

items.title: Cybersecurity startup raises $20m for identity protection
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Clutch Security, a Tel Aviv-based cybersecurity firm, raised US$20 million in Series A funding, totaling US$28.5 million to date.
- The funding round was led by SignalFire, with participation from Lightspeed Venture Partners and Merlin Ventures.
- The startup aims to enhance its workforce and platform, focusing on R&D, product innovation, and scaling sales and marketing.
- The company targets enterprise clients in banking, financial services, insurance, and technology sectors.
- The investment addresses the growing need for securing non-human identities (NHIs) like API keys and service accounts.
- Clutch Security offers a Universal NHI Security Platform with features such as Identity Lineage tracking and real-time anomaly detection.

items.title: Indian automobile marketplace CarTrade reports $5.26m profit
items.summary:
- CarTrade, an Indian automobile marketplace, reported a profit of $5.26 million.
- The report highlights CarTrade's financial performance despite market challenges.
- This profit represents a significant milestone for the company in the competitive automotive sector.

items.title: Trump’s media firm launches new fintech services
items.summary:
- Trump Media and Technology Group announced the launch of a new financial services brand, Truth.Fi, on Jan. 29.
- Company shares rose over 15% in premarket trading following the announcement.
- The firm plans to diversify cash holdings exceeding US$700 million and has authorized an investment of up to US$250 million through Charles Schwab across various assets.

items.title: AI agent platform AI16z rebrands as ElizaOS
items.author: Shaw Walters
items.summary:
- AI platform AI16z has rebranded to ElizaOS due to trademark issues with the name's similarity to a16z.
- Founder Shaw Walters announced the change on social media for a more professional identity.
- ElizaOS's cryptocurrency token will retain the ai16z ticker temporarily, with future changes decided by community vote via DAO.

items.title: Geotech firm MapmyIndia sees 3% rise on strong Q3 results
items.summary:
- Shares of MapmyIndia increased nearly 3% on Jan. 29, closing at 1,654 rupees (US$19.10).
- Q3 2025 consolidated net profit rose 4% YoY to 32.32 crore rupees (US$3.73 million).
- EBITDA grew 15.7% to 41.7 crore rupees (US$4.82 million) but EBITDA margin declined to 36.4%.
- Revenue from operations increased by 24% to 114.54 crore rupees (US$13.23 million).
- Operating expenses rose 32% to 79.40 crore rupees (US$9.17 million).
- MapmyIndia acquired a 9.37% stake in AI startup SimDaaS Autonomy for 3 crore rupees (US$346,521).
- The company partnered with KOGO AI to introduce India’s first universal voice assistant for the automotive industry.
- MapmyIndia targets to surpass 1,000 crore rupees (US$115.51 million) in revenue by FY27-FY28 with a CAGR of 35-40%.

items.title: Cloud platform Finout raises $40m series C
items.summary:
- Finout has successfully raised $40 million in a Series C funding round.
- The funding will be used to enhance its cloud cost management platform.
- This series brings Finout's total funding to date to $80 million.

items.title: Israeli AI firm UVeye raises $191m for global vehicle scans
items.summary:
- UVeye, an Israeli AI company, raised US$191 million for vehicle inspection technology.
- Funding included a US$41 million equity investment led by Woven Capital, Toyota's growth fund.
- Additionally, US$150 million was raised through debt financing via Trinity Capital.
- Founded in 2016, UVeye provides rapid, data-driven vehicle inspections used by dealerships, fleets, and auction sites.

items.title: AI demand boosts ASML’s Q4 bookings to $7.4b
items.summary:
- ASML reported €7.09 billion (US$7.4 billion) in Q4 2024 bookings, exceeding expectations of €3.53 billion (US$3.68 billion).
- Increased demand attributed to AI growth, despite concerns over China's AI advancements.
- ASML's market value fell by €19 billion (US$19.80 billion) over DeepSeek's competitive AI claims.
- US export restrictions continue to limit ASML's advanced lithography sales to China.
- AI infrastructure investments from Meta, OpenAI, SoftBank, and Oracle may benefit ASML.
- Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) plans up to US$42 billion in spending for 2025, indicating strong demand.

items.title: Trump Campaign Manager Joins Coinbase Advisory Council
items.summary:
- Coinbase Global Inc. has announced new members for its global advisory council.
- Chris LaCivita, co-manager of Trump’s presidential campaign, is one of the new members.
- Other appointees include former Federal Reserve Bank of New York president William Dudley, former Senator Kyrsten Sinema, and Luis Alberto Moreno.
- The appointments aim to help Coinbase expand into payments and tokenized assets.
- Announcement date: January 29.

items.title: US Navy bans DeepSeek over security risks
items.summary:
- The United States Navy has banned the use of AI technology developed by the Chinese company DeepSeek due to security and ethical risks.
- An email sent to Navy personnel on Jan. 26 prohibits using DeepSeek’s AI model for both work and personal purposes.
- The directive aligns with the Navy’s Chief Information Officer’s policy on generative AI.
- Concerns were raised about the origin and functionality of DeepSeek's R1 model, known for its open-source framework.
- This action reflects growing US concerns over AI technologies from China.

items.title: Vietnam hopes its new fund can bring home AI, semiconductor crown
items.summary:
- Vietnam launches the Investment Support Fund to attract tech giants and address tech talent shortages.
- The fund prioritizes investments in semiconductor and AI industries.
- Eligible firms can get reimbursement for training and operational costs, aiming to enhance human capital in the tech sector.
- Unique eligibility criteria include employing 300 engineers, and firms aren’t required to meet minimum revenue thresholds.
- The fund provides cash grants and various reimbursements related to operational, training, and R&D costs, effective December 31.

items.title: These are Asia’s most active investors in AI
items.summary:
- The article identifies the most active investors in Asia’s AI sector over the past two years.
- Investors are ranked based on the number of deals made, favoring early-stage investments.
- Only firms that have invested in at least three AI startups within Asia in the last two years are featured.
- The list is updated daily for accuracy but may not reflect the latest publishing date.
- The article encourages readers to report any inaccuracies or missing information directly to Tech in Asia's research team.

items.title: Thailand approves TikTok’s $3.8b investment
items.summary:
- TikTok approved by Thailand’s Board of Investment for a US$3.8 billion investment in digital infrastructure.
- Investment will support data hosting services, starting operations in 2025.
- Part of Thailand’s plan to become a regional hub for data centers and cloud services.
- Other companies like Amazon Web Services and Google are planning similar developments in Thailand.

items.title: SoftBank may lead $500m round for Skild AI
items.author: Deepak Pathak, Abhinav Gupta
items.summary:
- SoftBank Group Corp. is in talks to lead a $500 million funding round for Skild AI, a Pittsburgh-based robotics software startup.
- This investment could increase Skild AI’s valuation from $1.5 billion to $4 billion by 2024.
- Skild AI, founded in 2023 by Carnegie Mellon professors, develops software for robots to perform complex tasks.
- Notable backers of Skild AI include Amazon, Menlo Ventures, and Sequoia Capital.
- The negotiations are currently unconfirmed by SoftBank and there has been no response from Skild AI.

items.title: US-based Helion Energy raises $425m series F
items.summary:
- Helion Energy has raised US$425 million in its series F funding round.
- New investors include Lightspeed, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, and a major university endowment.
- Existing investors such as Sam Altman and Mithril Capital also participated.
- The funds will be used to expand manufacturing capabilities in the U.S. for components like capacitors, magnets, and semiconductors.

items.title: Honda to manufacture electric motorcycles in India by 2028
items.summary:
- Honda plans to start manufacturing electric motorcycles in India by 2028.
- The initiative is part of Honda's global strategy to enhance its presence in the electric vehicle market.
- The move is expected to leverage India's growing demand for electric two-wheelers and government support for EV adoption.

items.title: LinkedIn co-founder launches AI drug discovery startup
items.author: Reid Hoffman, Dr. Siddhartha Mukherjee
items.summary:
- LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman launched Manas AI, a drug discovery startup, on Jan. 27.
- The startup aims to develop treatments for cancer and rare diseases using AI and computational tools.
- The company raised US$24.6 million in seed funding, co-led by General Catalyst and Reid Hoffman, with participation from Greylock.
- The funding will support scaling the AI platform and advancing drug candidates globally.
- Manas AI partnered with Microsoft to utilize its Azure cloud computing platform for molecular docking capabilities.

items.title: Microsoft, OpenAI investigate DeepSeek for data misuse
items.summary:
- Microsoft and OpenAI are investigating potential unauthorized access of their AI model data by individuals associated with Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.
- Unusual activity was flagged by Microsoft's security team last fall, indicating that DeepSeek might have extracted large amounts of data from OpenAI’s API, possibly breaching terms of service.
- OpenAI has recognized a rise in attempts by Chinese entities to exploit US AI models but has not provided updates on the investigation.

items.title: Australia warns citizens on DeepSeek
items.author: Jim Chalmers
items.summary:
- Australia’s Treasurer, Jim Chalmers, cautioned citizens about the Chinese AI model DeepSeek.
- The warning was issued during a news conference on January 27.
- The government is actively monitoring developments related to DeepSeek, which was introduced earlier this week and has garnered considerable international attention.

items.title: Apple’s got an Indonesia-sized headache
items.summary:
- Apple is currently unable to sell the iPhone 16 in Indonesia due to local content requirements.
- Indonesian law mandates that at least 40% of smartphone components must be locally produced.
- Apple proposed a $1 billion factory for AirTags, but the Indonesian government deemed this insufficient.
- Options for Apple include investing in local factories for accessories, setting up data or R&D centers, or forming a joint venture with an Indonesian company.

items.title: Italy probes DeepSeek over data use, privacy
items.summary:
- Italy’s data protection authority, Garante, is investigating Chinese AI model DeepSeek over personal data handling.
- Officials are probing data collection details, sources, purpose, legal basis, and storage location, with a 20-day response deadline for DeepSeek.
- This investigation represents one of the first regulatory actions against DeepSeek, which has emerged as a low-cost alternative to US AI competitors.
- Garante is recognized for its proactive approach in AI regulation.

items.title: Apple, SpaceX, T-Mobile test Starlink on iPhones
items.summary:
- Apple is collaborating with SpaceX and T-Mobile to integrate Starlink satellite support into iPhones.
- The iOS 18.3 update enabled Starlink connectivity, allowing T-Mobile iPhone users to send texts in areas without cellular service.
- The beta test, currently limited to a small group, is expected to expand in February.
- Unlike Globalstar, Starlink works automatically and doesn't require users to point their phone at the sky.
- The service is currently available only in the US and supports texting, with plans for global expansion and additional features.

items.title: OpenAI unveils ChatGPT Gov for US agencies
items.summary:
- OpenAI launched ChatGPT Gov on Jan. 28, designed for US government agencies.
- The AI chatbot can be integrated within Microsoft Azure cloud infrastructure.
- Features include capabilities similar to ChatGPT Enterprise, like creating custom GPTs.
- This follows CEO Sam Altman's call for quicker product releases.
- The announcement comes as DeepSeek, a Chinese AI startup, surpassed ChatGPT in App Store downloads.

items.title: Sony’s finance chief Hiroki Totoki named CEO
items.summary:
- Hiroki Totoki will become Sony's CEO on April 1, succeeding Kenichiro Yoshida, who remains chairman.
- Currently president, Totoki oversaw Sony’s gaming division including PlayStation 5.
- Lin Tao will be Sony's first female CFO, and Hideaki Nishino will lead the gaming division.
- Sony shares rose 3.6% after the announcement, outperforming the Tokyo market's 0.9% rise.
- Totoki has emphasized growth in intellectual property and semiconductors.
- Sony’s gaming sector drew attention with a US$3.6 billion acquisition of Bungie, and upcoming titles may enhance its appeal.

items.title: X teams up with Visa to expand digital payments: sources
items.summary:
- X is collaborating with Visa to enhance digital payment systems.
- This partnership aims to broaden the reach of digital payments.
- Further details on the specifics of the collaboration were not disclosed.

items.title: Taiwan weighs support on chips amid US tariff proposal
items.summary:
- Taiwan is evaluating measures to support its semiconductor industry following US tariffs proposed by President Trump.
- Premier Cho Jung-tai stated that the government will review the necessity of cooperative plans or assistance programs.
- TSMC has significantly increased its US investments to $65 billion, up from a previous $12 billion.

items.title: Arm China names new CEO amid AI, geopolitical shifts
items.summary:
- Arm China appoints Chen Feng as new CEO.
- Appointment aims to address leadership challenges and adapt to technological and geopolitical changes.
- Follows resignation of interim co-CEOs Liu Renchen and Eric Chen after the ouster of former CEO Allen Wu in 2022.
- Arm China is pivotal in the US-China tech rivalry, as its chip designs power most smartphones, including Apple's iPhone.
- The US has imposed export curbs on advanced AI chips amid rising tensions, while China is wary of past trade policies.

items.title: Australian neurodivergent social app Spoony raises $1m
items.author: Nicholas Carlton, Kenneth Liang
items.summary:
- Australian startup Spoony raised US$1 million in pre-seed funding to grow its platform for disabled, neurodivergent, and chronically ill users.
- Funding was led by Antler Ventures, with contributions from Melba Support and Trampoline.
- Since its soft launch in September, it has attracted over 22,000 users and has a significant waitlist.
- Spoony addresses social isolation faced by neurodivergent individuals on mainstream platforms via a unique energy status display.
- Plans for revenue include partnerships with businesses, healthcare providers, and developing educational content and AI support.
- The startup aims to expand to the US, UK, and Canada to serve global neurodivergent and disabled communities.

items.title: Will big banks tank BNPL startups?
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- Banks in Indonesia are rapidly expanding their buy now, pay later (BNPL) services, outpacing fintech startups such as Akulaku and Kredivo.
- Just six banks currently offer BNPL, yet they control 2.5 times the volume disbursed by fintechs.
- HSBC is shutting down its payments app Zing after just a year, risking about 400 jobs; this highlights the challenges large corporations face when incubating startups.

items.title: Charting Asia’s M&As: When do startups usually make an exit?
items.author: Elyssa Lopez, Queena Wadyanti, Yeo Cheng Yong, Timmy Loen, Collin Furtado, Jaclyn Tiu
items.summary:
- Many startups do not have a clear exit strategy, according to investors and founders.
- Exit strategies include mergers and acquisitions (M&As), initial public offerings, and liquidation.
- The article provides data to help founders and investors determine the best timing for exit through M&As in Asia.

items.title: White House evaluates national security risks of DeepSeek AI
items.author: Karoline Leavitt, David Sacks
items.summary:
- US officials are reviewing national security concerns about DeepSeek, an AI app developed in China.
- The National Security Council is leading the review due to potential impacts on US AI companies.
- Concerns include potential intellectual property theft and countermeasures by US AI firms.
- DeepSeek's affordable AI models have caused declines in global technology stocks, raising fears of competition with US leaders like OpenAI and Alphabet.
- The US Commerce Department has imposed restrictions on AI hardware exports to China.

items.title: UK monitors DeepSeek AI app’s impact on security and data
items.summary:
- The UK government is monitoring the impact of the DeepSeek AI app on national security.
- Prime Minister Keir Starmer's spokesperson emphasized the government's commitment to oversight of new technologies as of January 28.
- DeepSeek's app has quickly risen to the top of the US App Store following its recent launch.
- Strict regulations are in place regarding technology use on government devices in the UK.
- The UK has strong data protection laws applicable to all firms, with compliance penalties.

items.title: US-based AI startup revenue surges to $300m
items.author: Jonathan Siddharth
items.summary:
- Artificial intelligence data startup Turing's revenue tripled to US$300 million in 2024, achieving profitability.
- The firm, based in Palo Alto, was valued at US$1.1 billion in 2021 and serves high-profile clients including OpenAI, Google, Anthropic, and Meta.
- Turing contracts over 4 million experts for data annotation to aid in model training, addressing data shortages in AI development.

items.title: China’s semiconductor firm breaks US export limits
Investment firms acquire $1b of Musk’s X debt
items.summary:
- Diameter Capital Partners and Darsana Capital Partners acquire $1 billion in debt related to Elon Musk’s acquisition of X.
- Loans were arranged by a Morgan Stanley-led consortium to gauge demand before a larger $3 billion debt offering.
- The move is part of efforts to offload portions of Musk’s $13 billion debt from the 2022 buyout, which has decreased in value to around 60 cents on the dollar.
- Other firms like PIMCO and Apollo Global Management are also interested in the additional debt package but no deals have been finalized.

items.title: AI startup nets $25m series A led by Khosla Ventures
items.summary:
- AI startup secures $25 million in Series A funding.
- The funding round is led by Khosla Ventures.
- The investment aims to enhance the startup's product development and market presence.

items.title: Google fights $4.5b EU fine over Android antitrust claims
items.summary:
- Google contested a €4.3 billion fine at the EU’s Court of Justice on Jan. 27, concerning anti-competitive practices related to Android.
- The fine, issued in 2018, accused Google of requiring pre-installation of Google Search and Chrome for app store access and limiting alternative Android versions.
- Google claims the Commission made errors in investigations, attributing Android's success to innovation.
- A final decision on the appeal is anticipated in the coming months.

items.title: Philips CEO warns EU rules threaten AI innovation
items.author: Roy Jakobs, Christian Klein, Pekka Lundmark
items.summary:
- Roy Jakobs, CEO of Royal Philips, warns EU regulations could stifle AI innovation.
- He spoke at the ICT & Health World Conference on January 28, emphasizing the risk of Europe falling behind in AI.
- Other industry leaders support delaying AI regulations to simplify the current framework for better competitiveness.

items.title: Pro-crypto Scott Bessent confirmed as US Treasury chief
items.summary:
- Scott Bessent confirmed as US Treasury Secretary on Jan. 27 with a 68-29 vote.
- Nominated by President Donald Trump, he succeeds Janet Yellen.
- A hedge fund manager, he is an advocate for cryptocurrency and opposes a US central bank digital currency.
- Will join the Presidential Working Group on Digital Asset Markets to focus on digital asset regulations.
- May propose a universal tariff on US imports ranging from 2.5% to 20%.

items.title: UK launches probe into AWS, Microsoft cloud market dominance
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- The UK government has initiated a probe into the cloud market, focusing on dominance by AWS and Microsoft.
- The investigation aims to assess competition concerns and potential market abuses.
- This move is part of a broader effort by regulators to ensure fair play in the technology sector.

items.title: ASML faces growth concerns amid DeepSeek, Trump export risks
items.summary:
- ASML will report Q4 earnings on January 31.
- Concerns arise over growth outlook for 2025 due to DeepSeek's AI model requiring less computing power.
- Uncertainty exists regarding potential US export restrictions on ASML's older DUV products to China.
- ASML projects 2025 sales of €30-35 billion driven by AI chip demand, but investors await confirmation through bookings.

items.title: Shares of Australian AI firms drop after DeepSeek’s launch
items.summary:
- Shares of Australian AI firms fell on Jan. 28 following the launch of DeepSeek's low-cost AI assistant.
- Appen’s stock dropped 3.3% and Brainchip saw a decline of 10.3%.
- The technology sub-index decreased by 1%.
- DeepSeek's AI assistant operates with lower data requirements and at a reduced cost.
- Australian data-center-related companies also faced declines: Goodman Group (-6.4%), NEXTDC (-6.2%), DigiCo Infrastructure REIT (-11.1%).
- Concerns about reduced spending on data infrastructure due to DeepSeek’s product surfaced.

items.title: 50 rising greentech startups in Asia
items.summary:
- The article lists cleantech startups in Asia that have recently raised funding, indicating potential for growth.
- It includes companies up to the series E stage, with details about their funding rounds.
- The list is updated regularly and aims to track emerging startups in the greentech sector.

items.title: India-based gaming startup raises $1.2m for growth
items.author: Prince Thomas, Ranjit Kumar Behera, Ajith Sunny
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based gaming startup MetaShot raised 11 crore rupees (around US$1.2 million) through equity and debt financing.
- The funding round was led by Sauce VC, with contributions from Sharrp Ventures and Panthera Peak Capital.
- Founded in 2021, MetaShot plans to use the funds for team expansion, research and development, and growth strategies.
- The MetaShot smart bat, launched in August 2023, translates real-world cricket shots into game actions.
- The smart bat offers six hours of playtime, USB-C charging, and Bluetooth connectivity to mobile phones.

items.title: Delhivery shares hit 52-week low, recover slightly
items.summary:
- Delhivery shares hit a 52-week low of 306.50 rupees on Jan. 28 during intraday trading.
- Shares recovered to 317.45 rupees, marking a 1.21% increase.
- Market capitalization is now at 23,601.22 crore rupees with approximately 770,000 shares traded.
- This is the second consecutive session with a new 52-week low, despite closing the last three sessions negatively.
- Over the past month, stocks have declined by 8.38% and by 25.51% in the past year.

items.title: Arizona passes first US bill for public bitcoin Investment
items.author: Wendy Rogers, Jeff Weninger
items.summary:
- Arizona Senate Finance Committee approved the Arizona Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Act (SB 1025) with a 5-2 vote.
- The bill allows public funds to invest up to 10% in cryptocurrency.
- If passed, Arizona will be the first state to mandate public funds to hold bitcoin.
- The bill will proceed to the Senate Rules Committee for more discussion before heading to the House of Representatives.
